meanings.definition: Include or absorb (something) in something else
meanings.sent1: The new law will subsume all previous regulations.
meanings.sent2: In biology, cells subsume nutrients to grow and function.
meanings.sent3: The hungry monster tried to subsume all the cookies in one bite.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music subsumes her entire being.
meanings.sent5: The darkness seemed to subsume everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To classify or include under a more general category
meanings.sent1: The new textbook will subsume various topics under one chapter.
meanings.sent2: In botany, we subsume different plants into specific families.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to subsume all animals under the category of 'mystical creatures'.
meanings.sent4: His speech subsumed all his achievements under the title of 'success'.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece subsumed all art forms into a single canvas.
